title: OCAI Assessment
subtitle: Organizational Culture Assessment Instrument
description: Understand your organization's current culture and envision your preferred future culture.

instructions.title: Assessment Instructions
instructions.intro: This assessment helps identify your organization's current culture and your preferred culture for the future.
instructions.step1: For each question, divide 100 points among four alternatives
instructions.step2: Give higher points to the alternative that best describes your organization
instructions.step4: The total must equal 100 for each question

clan.name: Clan
clan.subtitle: Collaborate
clan.description: Friendly, family-like environment focused on teamwork and employee development
clan.characteristics: A very personal place. Like an extended family. Leaders are mentors. The organization is held together by loyalty and tradition. Commitment is high. Emphasis on teamwork, participation, and consensus.

adhocracy.name: Adhocracy
adhocracy.subtitle: Create
adhocracy.description: Dynamic, entrepreneurial environment focused on innovation and growth
adhocracy.characteristics: Dynamic and entrepreneurial workplace. People take risks. Leaders are innovators and risk takers. The emphasis is on being at the leading edge. Long-term focus on growth and acquiring new resources.

market.name: Market
market.subtitle: Compete
market.description: Results-oriented environment focused on competition and achievement
market.characteristics: Results-oriented workplace. Leaders are hard drivers and competitors. The focus is on winning. Success is defined by market share and penetration. Competitive pricing and market leadership are important.

hierarchy.name: Hierarchy
hierarchy.subtitle: Control
hierarchy.description: Structured, controlled environment focused on efficiency and stability
hierarchy.characteristics: Formalized and structured workplace. Procedures govern what people do. Leaders are coordinators and organizers. Maintaining smooth-running operations is important. Focus on efficiency, predictability, and stability.

dominant_characteristics.title: Dominant Characteristics
dominant_characteristics.description: The organization is a very personal place. It is like an extended family. People seem to share a lot of themselves.
dominant_characteristics.optionA: The organization is a very personal place. It is like an extended family. People seem to share a lot of themselves.
dominant_characteristics.optionB: The organization is a very dynamic and entrepreneurial place. People are willing to stick their necks out and take risks.
dominant_characteristics.optionC: The organization is very results oriented. A major concern is with getting the job done. People are very competitive and achievement oriented.
dominant_characteristics.optionD: The organization is a very controlled and structured place. Formal procedures generally govern what people do.

leadership.title: Leadership
leadership.description: The leadership in the organization is generally considered to exemplify mentoring, facilitating, or nurturing.
leadership.optionA: The leadership in the organization is generally considered to exemplify mentoring, facilitating, or nurturing.
leadership.optionB: The leadership in the organization is generally considered to exemplify entrepreneurship, innovating, or risk taking.
leadership.optionC: The leadership in the organization is generally considered to exemplify a no-nonsense, aggressive, results-oriented focus.
leadership.optionD: The leadership in the organization is generally considered to exemplify coordinating, organizing, or smooth-running efficiency.

management_employees.title: Management of Employees
management_employees.description: The management style in the organization is characterized by teamwork, consensus, and participation.
management_employees.optionA: The management style in the organization is characterized by teamwork, consensus, and participation.
management_employees.optionB: The management style in the organization is characterized by individual risk-taking, innovation, freedom, and uniqueness.
management_employees.optionC: The management style in the organization is characterized by hard-driving competitiveness, high demands, and achievement.
management_employees.optionD: The management style in the organization is characterized by security of employment, conformity, predictability, and stability in relationships.

organization_glue.title: Organization Glue
organization_glue.description: The glue that holds the organization together is loyalty and mutual trust. Commitment to this organization runs high.
organization_glue.optionA: The glue that holds the organization together is loyalty and mutual trust. Commitment to this organization runs high.
organization_glue.optionB: The glue that holds the organization together is commitment to innovation and development. There is an emphasis on being on the cutting edge.
organization_glue.optionC: The glue that holds the organization together is the emphasis on achievement and goal accomplishment. Aggressive and winning is the common thread.
organization_glue.optionD: The glue that holds the organization together is formal rules and policies. Maintaining a smooth-running organization is important.

strategic_emphases.title: Strategic Emphases
strategic_emphases.description: The organization emphasizes human development. High trust, openness, and participation persist.
strategic_emphases.optionA: The organization emphasizes human development. High trust, openness, and participation persist.
strategic_emphases.optionB: The organization emphasizes acquiring new resources and creating new challenges. Trying new things and prospecting for opportunities are valued.
strategic_emphases.optionC: The organization emphasizes competitive actions and achievement. Hitting stretch targets and winning in the marketplace are dominant.
strategic_emphases.optionD: The organization emphasizes permanence and stability. Efficiency, control, and smooth operations are valued.

criteria_success.title: Criteria of Success
criteria_success.description: The organization defines success on the basis of the development of human resources, teamwork, employee commitment, and concern for people.
criteria_success.optionA: The organization defines success on the basis of the development of human resources, teamwork, employee commitment, and concern for people.
criteria_success.optionB: The organization defines success on the basis of having the most unique or newest products. It is a product leader and innovator.
criteria_success.optionC: The organization defines success on the basis of winning in the marketplace and outpacing the competition. Competitive market leadership is key.
criteria_success.optionD: The organization defines success on the basis of efficiency. Dependable delivery, smooth scheduling, and low-cost production are critical.

clan.fullDescription: A friendly place to work where people share a lot of themselves. It is like an extended family. Leaders are thought of as mentors and perhaps even as parent figures. The organization is held together by loyalty or tradition. Commitment is high. The organization emphasizes the long-term benefit of human resource development and attaches great importance to cohesion and morale. Success is defined in terms of sensitivity to customers and concern for people. The organization places a premium on teamwork, participation, and consensus.

adhocracy.fullDescription: A dynamic, entrepreneurial, and creative place to work. People stick their necks out and take risks. Leaders are considered innovators and risk takers. The glue that holds the organization together is commitment to experimentation and innovation. The emphasis is on being on the leading edge. The organization's long-term emphasis is on growth and acquiring new resources. Success means gaining unique and new products or services. Being a product or service leader is important. The organization encourages individual initiative and freedom.

market.fullDescription: A results-oriented organization whose major concern is with getting the job done. People are competitive and goal-oriented. Leaders are hard drivers, producers, and competitors. They are tough and demanding. The glue that holds the organization together is an emphasis on winning. Reputation and success are common concerns. The long-term focus is on competitive actions and achieving stretch targets and goals. Success is defined in terms of market share and penetration. Competitive pricing and market leadership are important. The organizational style is hard-driving competitiveness.

hierarchy.fullDescription: A very formalized and structured place to work. Procedures govern what people do. Leaders pride themselves on being good coordinators and organizers who are efficiency-minded. Maintaining a smooth-running organization is most critical. The organization is held together by formal rules and policies. The long-term concern is on stability and performance with efficient, smooth operations. Success is defined in terms of dependable delivery, smooth scheduling, and low cost. Management wants security and predictability.

ocaiIntro.title: OCAI Assessment
ocaiIntro.subtitle: Organizational Culture Assessment Instrument
ocaiIntro.heroDescription: Understand your organization's current and preferred culture using the proven Competing Values Framework
ocaiIntro.step1Text: For each question, you'll see 4 statements (A, B, C, D) describing different aspects of your organization.
ocaiIntro.step2Text: Divide 100 points among the 4 statements based on how similar they are to your organization.
ocaiIntro.step3Text: You'll do this twice for each question:
ocaiIntro.preferredText: How you would like your organization to be in 5 years
ocaiIntro.rememberText: The total points for each question must equal 100.
ocaiIntro.privacy1: Your individual responses are confidential and will not be shared with anyone
ocaiIntro.privacy2: Only aggregate data is used for organizational analysis
ocaiIntro.privacy3: You can save your progress and return later
ocaiIntro.privacy4: Your honest feedback helps improve the organization
ocaiIntro.alreadyCompleted: You have already completed this assessment. You cannot retake it.
ocaiIntro.orgNotFound: Organization information not found. Please sign in again.
ocaiIntro.createFailed: Failed to create assessment. Please contact your administrator.
ocaiIntro.errorOccurred: An error occurred. Please try again or contact your administrator.
